title: ShapeKernel BaseBox
content: BaseBox is used for rectangular geometries. It takes three parameters: length, width, and height. Ideal for housings, frames, and structural components. Compatible with lattice infill for weight reduction.

metadata.example: For a motor housing, use BaseBox with dimensions 100x80x60 mm
metadata.training_text: BaseBox is used for rectangular geometries. It takes three parameters: length, width, and height. Ideal for housings, frames, and structural components. Compatible with lattice infill for weight reduction.

title: ShapeKernel BaseSphere
content: BaseSphere creates spherical geometry. Takes a radius parameter. Used for bearing components, connector heads, and rounded features. Can be combined with lattices for optimized structures.

metadata.example: Create a spherical bearing housing with 25mm radius
metadata.training_text: BaseSphere creates spherical geometry. Takes a radius parameter. Used for bearing components, connector heads, and rounded features. Can be combined with lattices for optimized structures.

title: ShapeKernel BaseCylinder
content: BaseCylinder creates cylindrical geometries. Parameters: radius and height. Used for shafts, connectors, tubes, and mounting posts. Excellent for rotational components and lattice infill.

metadata.example: Motor shaft: BaseCylinder with 5mm radius, 50mm height
metadata.training_text: BaseCylinder creates cylindrical geometries. Parameters: radius and height. Used for shafts, connectors, tubes, and mounting posts. Excellent for rotational components and lattice infill.

title: ShapeKernel BasePipe
content: BasePipe creates hollow cylindrical geometry. Parameters: outer_radius, inner_radius, height. Used for manifolds, tubing, fluid channels, and cable routing.

metadata.example: Cooling manifold: BasePipe outer=15mm, inner=10mm, height=80mm
metadata.training_text: BasePipe creates hollow cylindrical geometry. Parameters: outer_radius, inner_radius, height. Used for manifolds, tubing, fluid channels, and cable routing.

title: ShapeKernel BaseLens
content: BaseLens creates lens-shaped geometry. Parameters: radius and thickness. Used for optical components, curved mounts, and aesthetic features in optical systems.

metadata.example: Camera lens mount with 20mm radius, 5mm thickness
metadata.training_text: BaseLens creates lens-shaped geometry. Parameters: radius and thickness. Used for optical components, curved mounts, and aesthetic features in optical systems.

title: ShapeKernel BaseRing
content: BaseRing creates ring-shaped geometry. Parameters: outer_radius, inner_radius, thickness. Used for bearing components, seals, connector rings, and washers.

metadata.training_text: BaseRing creates ring-shaped geometry. Parameters: outer_radius, inner_radius, thickness. Used for bearing components, seals, connector rings, and washers.

title: Lattice Library BodyCenteredLattice
content: BodyCenteredLattice uses standard crystallographic structure connecting corner vertices with center points. Provides 30-40% weight reduction while maintaining structural integrity. Ideal for load-bearing components and optimization.

metadata.structure: Connects corner vertices diagonally with center point
metadata.training_text: BodyCenteredLattice uses standard crystallographic structure connecting corner vertices with center points. Provides 30-40% weight reduction while maintaining structural integrity. Ideal for load-bearing components and optimization.

title: Lattice Library OctahedronLattice
content: OctahedronLattice uses octahedral unit cell structure. Provides 25-35% weight reduction with balanced strength. Better impact absorption compared to body-centered lattices.

metadata.structure: Beam structure based on octahedral unit cells
metadata.training_text: OctahedronLattice uses octahedral unit cell structure. Provides 25-35% weight reduction with balanced strength. Better impact absorption compared to body-centered lattices.

title: Lattice Library RegularCellArray
content: RegularCellArray creates uniform periodic lattice structures. Cell dimensions can be customized. Supports noise/randomization for improved damping. Weight reduction 20-30% with consistent properties.

metadata.training_text: RegularCellArray creates uniform periodic lattice structures. Cell dimensions can be customized. Supports noise/randomization for improved damping. Weight reduction 20-30% with consistent properties.

title: Lattice Library ConformalCellArray
content: ConformalCellArray adapts lattice cells to follow the surface of complex shapes. Provides 25-40% weight reduction while maintaining surface integrity. Best for optimized complex geometries.

metadata.training_text: ConformalCellArray adapts lattice cells to follow the surface of complex shapes. Provides 25-40% weight reduction while maintaining surface integrity. Best for optimized complex geometries.

title: Lattice Rule: Cell size optimization
content: When designing lattice structures, maintain cell size between 10-50x the beam thickness. This ensures optimal structural properties and printability.

metadata.name: Cell size optimization
metadata.rule: Cell size should be 10-50x the beam thickness for optimal results
metadata.training_text: When designing lattice structures, maintain cell size between 10-50x the beam thickness. This ensures optimal structural properties and printability.

title: Lattice Rule: Beam thickness distribution
content: Apply gradient beam thickness distribution based on stress analysis. High-stress areas use thicker beams (1.5-2mm), low-stress areas use thinner beams (0.5-1mm).

metadata.name: Beam thickness distribution
metadata.rule: Vary beam thickness based on local stress: higher stress = thicker beams
metadata.training_text: Apply gradient beam thickness distribution based on stress analysis. High-stress areas use thicker beams (1.5-2mm), low-stress areas use thinner beams (0.5-1mm).

title: Lattice Rule: Manufacturing constraints
content: Manufacturing process constraints: FDM requires minimum 0.5mm beam thickness, SLA requires 0.3mm minimum, SLS allows 0.7mm minimum.

metadata.name: Manufacturing constraints
metadata.rule: Minimum beam thickness must be ≥0.5mm for FDM, ≥0.3mm for SLA
metadata.training_text: Manufacturing process constraints: FDM requires minimum 0.5mm beam thickness, SLA requires 0.3mm minimum, SLS allows 0.7mm minimum.

title: Robotics Domain: gripper_design
content: Gripper Design Rules: Apply 2x safety factor minimum. Jaw width ranges 20-150mm. Parallel gripper stroke 10-100mm. Use Al6061 for frames, stainless steel for contact surfaces. Grip force 50-500N based on payload.

rules: Payload capacity: minimum 2x safety factor on load
Jaw width: typically 20-150mm depending on application
Material: Al6061 for frames, stainless for jaws
metadata.training_text: Gripper Design Rules: Apply 2x safety factor minimum. Jaw width ranges 20-150mm. Parallel gripper stroke 10-100mm. Use Al6061 for frames, stainless steel for contact surfaces. Grip force 50-500N based on payload.

title: Robotics Domain: robot_arm
content: Robot Arm Design: Typical reach 500-2500mm. Payload inversely proportional to reach. Standard 6-DOF configuration. Use revolute joints for articulation, carbon fiber for light links. Maintain 2-3x safety factor.

rules: Joint types: revolute or linear depending on workspace
Material: carbon fiber for links, Al for joints
metadata.training_text: Robot Arm Design: Typical reach 500-2500mm. Payload inversely proportional to reach. Standard 6-DOF configuration. Use revolute joints for articulation, carbon fiber for light links. Maintain 2-3x safety factor.

title: Robotics Domain: actuator_selection
content: Actuator Selection: Servo motors for precision and smooth control. Stepper motors for cost-effective open-loop applications. Brushless motors for efficiency and speed. Linear actuators for extension motions. Pneumatics for extreme force needs.

rules: Servo: smooth motion, high precision, low power
Brushless motor: high efficiency, needs controller
metadata.training_text: Actuator Selection: Servo motors for precision and smooth control. Stepper motors for cost-effective open-loop applications. Brushless motors for efficiency and speed. Linear actuators for extension motions. Pneumatics for extreme force needs.

title: Robotics Domain: bearing_selection
content: Bearing Selection: Choose dynamic load rating 2x minimum. Ball bearings for low friction, roller bearings for heavy loads. Stainless steel for harsh environments. Apply light preload for precision applications.

rules: Load rating: minimum 2x dynamic load capacity
Type: ball bearing for low friction, roller for heavy loads
Preload: light preload for precision, no preload for low friction
metadata.training_text: Bearing Selection: Choose dynamic load rating 2x minimum. Ball bearings for low friction, roller bearings for heavy loads. Stainless steel for harsh environments. Apply light preload for precision applications.

title: Robotics Domain: material_selection
content: Material Selection: 3D printing use PLA for prototypes, ABS for impact, PETG for balanced properties, Nylon for durability. CNC use Al6061 for light structures, Steel for high strength. Consider cost-weight tradeoffs. Tolerance FDM ±0.3mm, SLA ±0.1mm, CNC ±0.05mm.

rules: 3D print: PLA (low cost), ABS (impact), PETG (balance), Nylon (durability)
Cost vs strength: PLA ($5/kg) vs Steel ($3/kg but heavier)
Weight: carbon fiber (-40% vs Al), titanium (+50% cost)
metadata.training_text: Material Selection: 3D printing use PLA for prototypes, ABS for impact, PETG for balanced properties, Nylon for durability. CNC use Al6061 for light structures, Steel for high strength. Consider cost-weight tradeoffs. Tolerance FDM ±0.3mm, SLA ±0.1mm, CNC ±0.05mm.

title: CEM Optimization: lightweight
content: Lightweight optimization: Apply 20-40% lattice infill using BodyCentric or Octahedron types. Reduce wall thickness to 1.5-2mm minimum. Use PLA/ABS for 3D print. Remove non-load-bearing features. Achieves 30-50% weight reduction with 5-15% cost increase.

rules: Use lighter materials (PLA > ABS > PETG > Al)
Apply topology optimization to remove dead material
metadata.training_text: Lightweight optimization: Apply 20-40% lattice infill using BodyCentric or Octahedron types. Reduce wall thickness to 1.5-2mm minimum. Use PLA/ABS for 3D print. Remove non-load-bearing features. Achieves 30-50% weight reduction with 5-15% cost increase.

title: CEM Optimization: cost_effective
content: Cost-effective optimization: Use FDM printing on PLA material. Minimize supports with optimal orientation. Accept standard ±0.3mm tolerance. Use 0% infill for non-load bearing parts. Consolidate parts when possible. Achieves 35-50% cost reduction with acceptable weight.

metadata.training_text: Cost-effective optimization: Use FDM printing on PLA material. Minimize supports with optimal orientation. Accept standard ±0.3mm tolerance. Use 0% infill for non-load bearing parts. Consolidate parts when possible. Achieves 35-50% cost reduction with acceptable weight.

title: CEM Optimization: durable
content: Durable design: Apply 3.0x safety factor instead of 2.0x. Use PETG or Nylon for high-stress applications. Wall thickness 2.5-3mm minimum. Add 1-2mm edge chamfers to reduce stress concentration. Reinforcing ribs at corners and joints. Achieves 2x typical lifespan.

rules: Add reinforcing ribs at stress concentrations
metadata.training_text: Durable design: Apply 3.0x safety factor instead of 2.0x. Use PETG or Nylon for high-stress applications. Wall thickness 2.5-3mm minimum. Add 1-2mm edge chamfers to reduce stress concentration. Reinforcing ribs at corners and joints. Achieves 2x typical lifespan.

title: CEM Optimization: high_precision
content: High precision: SLA provides ±0.1mm tolerance, CNC provides ±0.05mm. Apply tight tolerances only to critical mating surfaces. Post-process polishing required. Cost increases 50-200% for precision. Best for optical and critical assemblies.

rules: Post-process: polishing for SLA, deburring for CNC
Tight tolerances on mating surfaces only
metadata.training_text: High precision: SLA provides ±0.1mm tolerance, CNC provides ±0.05mm. Apply tight tolerances only to critical mating surfaces. Post-process polishing required. Cost increases 50-200% for precision. Best for optical and critical assemblies.

title: CEM Optimization: rapid_prototyping
content: Rapid prototyping: FDM printing on PLA for fastest 24-48hr turnaround. Design for 45° overhangs to minimize supports. Use 2-3mm walls for test strength. Accept ±0.3mm tolerance for iteration cycles.

metadata.training_text: Rapid prototyping: FDM printing on PLA for fastest 24-48hr turnaround. Design for 45° overhangs to minimize supports. Use 2-3mm walls for test strength. Accept ±0.3mm tolerance for iteration cycles.
